msItem.title: Of Gregory Nyssen
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܓܪܝܓܪܝܘܣ ܕܥܠ ܣܛܦܐܢܘܣ ܪܝܫܐ ܕܣܗ̈ܕܐ.
msItem.note: See Opera, t. iii., from p. 356 C, διάκονον μυστηρίων Χριστοῦ, to p. 358 D, τίνα φέρει τῶν λυπούντων διόρθωσιν; and from p. 361 A, καὶ τῶν ἀπὸ τῆς 'Αλεξύνδρου πόλεως σοφῶν αὐτῷ προσπαλαίουσθαι, to the end.

msItem.title: Of John Chrysostom
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܐܢܝܣ ܕܥܠ ܣܛܦܐܢܘܣ ܪܝܫܐ ܕܣ̈ܗܕܐ
msItem.incipit: ܫܘܦܪܐ ܕܢܨ̈ܚܢܘܗܝ ܕܣܗܕܐ ܣܛܦܐܢܘܣ: ܗܢܐ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܒܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ ܕܐܫܬܟ̣ܚܬ̇ ܒܟܪܡܐ ܕܣܗܕܘܬܐ: ܡܓܪܓ ܠܝ ܝܘܡܢ ܕܥܠܘܗܝ ܐ̇ܡܠܠ܆ ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Of Jacob of Batnae
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܠܦܢܐ ܕܥܠ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܣܛܦܐܢܘܣ ܪܝܫܐ ܕܡܫܡ̈ܫܢܐ ܘܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܣ̈ܗܕܐ
msItem.incipit: ܒܘܟܪܐ ܕܣ̈ܗܕܐ ܩܪܢܝ ܠܚܠܘܠܗ ܪܘܚܢܝܐ̣. ܗܒ ܠܝ ܡܪܢ ܕܒܪ̈ܘܡܝܢܐ ܐܚܕܐ ܥܡܗ.

item.p: It consists of six paper leaves, about 13 3/8 in. by 7 3/4, the last of which is much torn. Each page is divided into two columns of from 34 to 39 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of the xiith cent.

msItem.title: Part of the metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the Rich Man and Lazarus

item.p: Five paper leaves, about 13 in. by 7 5/8, all more or less torn. There are from 38 to 43 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is large and rather inelegant, of the xith or xiith cent.

msItem.title: A fragment of the metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on S. Simeon and the Presentation of our Lord
Hymns for the Commemoration of S. Simeon

item.p: It consists of three paper leaves, about 11 3/4 in. by 8, much torn. There are 25 lines in each full page.

handNote.desc: The writing is large and inelegant, of the xiith cent.

msItem.title: Fragments of a Choral Service-book, containing hymns and prayers for various occasions

item.p: It consists of four paper leaves, all more or less stained and torn. Each page is divided into two columns of from 17 to 23 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is large and regular, of the xiiith cent.

msItem.title: Part of the Index to a large Lectionary

item.p: It consists of four paper leaves, about 9 ½ in. by 7 ½, all much torn.

handNote.desc: The writing is of the xiii or xiv cent.

msItem.title: Index to a Service-book, comprising a collection of sedras
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܩܘܕܝܟܣ ܡܚܲܘܝܢܐ ܕܛܟ̈ܣܐ ܕܐܝܬ ܒܗܢܐ ܟܬܒܐ ܩܲܕܝܫܐ ܕܣܕܪ̈ܐ.

item.p: It is a paper leaf, 10 1/4 in. by 7 1/8, much torn.
On the verso there are two notes. The first one is in Arabic, and dated in the year 1199 of the Coptic era, Ryan on April 23, 2011 noted that it needs Arabic-->, , A.D. 1483.

The other note is in Karshūnī, and states that this volume was given, as a waḳf or legacy, to the convent of S. Mary Deipara by a monk named Ephraim, ܝܩܘܠ ܡܣܛܪܗܐ ܐܦܪܐܡ ܐܠܪܐܗܒ ܐܠܣܪܝܐܢܝ ܐܢܝ ܐܘܩܦܬ ܗܕܐ ܐܠܟܬܐܒ ܐܠܡܒܐܪܟ ܐܠـ . . . ܐܠܚܣܐܝܐܬ ܥܠܝ [ܕܝܪ] ܣܬܢܐ ܐܠܣܝܕܗ ܐܠܡ̇ܥـ[ܛܡܗ] ܡܣܟܢ ܐܠܣܪ̈ܝܐܢ ܦܝ ܒܪ[ܝܗ] ܐܠܐܣܩܝܛ ܘܩܦܐ ܡܐ[ܒܕܐ] ܘܚܒܣܐ ܡܟܠܕܐ ܐܠ܏ܟ.

item.p: The last leaf of a paper manuscript, much mutilated.

handNote.desc: It is written in a current hand of the xiiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
